metadata.Title: CVE-2020-28009 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Exim 4 before 4.94.2 allows Integer Overflow to Buffer Overflow because get_stdinput allows unbounded reads that are accompanied by unbounded increases in a certain size variable. NOTE: exploitation may be impractical because of the execution time needed to overflow (multiple days).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-28009` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

exim4 - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4+esm3
exim4-base - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4+esm3
exim4-config - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4+esm3
exim4-daemon-heavy - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4+esm3
exim4-daemon-light - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4+esm3
eximon4 - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: exim4 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.82-3ubuntu2.4+esm3').
